body.p:
The view allows you to insert attributes or change the value of the already used attributes for the current editable element. An element is editable if any one of the following is true:
The CSS stylesheet associated with the document does not specify a false value for the -oxy-editable property associated with the element.
The element is entirely included in a deleted Track Changes marker.
The element is part of a content fragment that is referenced in Author mode from another document.
A combo box located in the upper part of the view allows you to edit the attributes of the ancestors of the current element.
The following actions are available in the contextual menu of the Attributes view when editing in Author mode:

section.title: In-place Attributes Editor
section.p:
To edit the attributes of an XML element in-place while editing in Author mode, do one of the following:
Select an element or place the caret inside it and then press the keyboard shortcut.
Double-click any named start tag when the document is edited in one of the following display modes.: Full Tags with Attributes, Full Tags, Block Tags, or Inline Tags.

This opens an in-place attributes editor that contains the same content as the Attributes view. By default, this editor presents the Name and Value fields, with the list of all the possible attributes collapsed.

You can use the drop-down menu to display the list of possible attributes allowed by the schema of the document, as in the Attributes view. If you click More while in the collapsed version, it is expanded to the full version of the in-place attribute editor.
The Name field auto-completes the name of the attribute (the complete name of the attribute is suggested based on the prefix already typed in the field).
